designReference: Clean, modern health dashboard like InsideTracker. Soft shadows, consistent color coding (green=optimal, yellow=normal, pink/red=out of range). Good typography hierarchy. Polished but not flashy.

userStories.title: Tab navigation system
acceptanceCriteria: Top navigation bar with tabs: Dashboard, Biomarkers, Goals, Data Sources
Use Next.js App Router for pages
Tabs work without full page reload
userStories.notes: Create app/(main)/dashboard, app/(main)/biomarkers, app/(main)/goals, app/(main)/data-sources folders. Shared layout with tab nav.

userStories.title: Color system and design tokens
acceptanceCriteria: Status colors: optimal (#10b981 green), normal (#eab308 yellow), outOfRange (#ec4899 pink)
Background colors: card (#ffffff), page (#f8fafc), accent backgrounds
Consistent shadow tokens: sm, md, lg
Border radius tokens: sm (6px), md (12px), lg (16px)
All components use these tokens, not hardcoded colors
userStories.notes: Single source of truth for design. Import tokens everywhere.

userStories.title: Biomarker summary card
acceptanceCriteria: Shows: Total count, Optimal count, Normal count, Out of Range count
Horizontal stacked bar showing proportion (green | yellow | pink)
userStories.notes: Reference: InsideTracker screenshot. 105 Total | 50 Optimal | 40 Normal | 15 Out of Range with colored bar below.

userStories.title: Biomarker search and filter controls
acceptanceCriteria: Search input to filter biomarkers by name
Dropdown filter: All ranges, Optimal, Normal, Out of Range
Dropdown filter: Category (Lipids, Metabolic, Inflammation, Hormones, etc.)
userStories.notes: Use shadcn Select or custom dropdown. Search is instant filter, not submit-based.

userStories.title: Biomarker table with status badges
acceptanceCriteria: Status column: colored badge (Optimal/Normal/Out of Range)
Rows are cards with subtle separation
userStories.notes: Not a traditional table - more like stacked cards. Each row is its own card.

userStories.title: Sparkline history charts
acceptanceCriteria: Shows reference range as background band (green zone)
Current value as dot on the line
userStories.notes: Use recharts or visx for sparklines. Show optimal range as light green background band.

userStories.title: Biomarkers page assembly
acceptanceCriteria: Layout: Summary card at top, filters below, table below filters
userStories.notes: Assemble components into full page.

userStories.title: Health Score calculation
acceptanceCriteria: Score based on: % optimal biomarkers, PhenoAge delta, activity metrics
userStories.notes: Simple weighted formula. 100 = perfect health. 0 = everything out of range.

userStories.title: Health Score card
acceptanceCriteria: Large circular or semi-circular gauge showing score
Status label: Optimal (80+), Good (60-79), Fair (40-59), Needs Work (<40)
Clean card design matching other cards
userStories.notes: Prominent score display. Can use SVG arc or recharts RadialBarChart.

userStories.title: Goals generation from health data
acceptanceCriteria: generateGoals(healthData) returns array of Goal objects
Goal: { id, title, description, priority: 'high'|'medium'|'low', category, actionItems[] }
Generates goals based on out-of-range biomarkers
High priority: significantly out of range or critical markers (LDL, glucose)
Medium priority: moderately out of range
Low priority: borderline or optimization opportunities
userStories.notes: Reference HEALTH_KNOWLEDGE.md for what goals to generate. E.g., high LDL â†’ 'Lower artery-clogging cholesterol'

userStories.title: Goal cards with gradient backgrounds
acceptanceCriteria: Priority badge in top right corner
userStories.notes: Reference: InsideTracker Goals screenshot. Rich gradient backgrounds with white text overlay.

userStories.title: Goals page assembly

Empty state if no goals (everything optimal)
